meanings.sent1: In ancient Greece, people used oboles to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist found a collection of oboles during the excavation.
meanings.sent3: The museum curator joked that the oboles were so tiny, they could easily get lost.
meanings.sent4: The oboles glinted in the sunlight, like specks of gold scattered on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The oboles clinked together in the old chest, a sound from a bygone era.

meanings.sent1: She only had a few oboles of flour left to bake the cake.
meanings.sent2: He offered an oboles of wisdom to help his friend through tough times.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored oboles of nuts in its secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like oboles of joy sprinkled in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist added oboles of color to the painting, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
